children.name: Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI();
children.text2: The following shows how to initialize AccAgentsAPI.

children.name: AccAgentsAPI()
children.text: Creates an AccAgentsAPI instance.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var logRequestStatus = agentsApi.checkGrabLogRequestProgress("<request_ID>"); gs.info(JSON.stringify(logRequestStatus, null, 2));
children.text2:
The following  shows how to use a request ID to get the status of a grab log
        request.

children.name: requestId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a request in the Agent Client Collector Requests [sn_agent_request] table.

children.name: <Object>
status
children.text:
Number indicating status of the grab log request.
Possible values:
  • 0: Grab log request is complete.
  • 1: Grab log request in progress.
  • 2: Grab log request timed out.
  • 3: Grab log request has an error.
  • 4: Grab log request was not found.

children.name: output
children.text: Information describing the status.

children.name: checkGrabLogRequestProgress(String requestId)
children.text: Checks the status of a grab log request.
children.text2: Run the submitGrabLogRequest() method to get a request ID.

children.name: Output
children.text: agent status: 2

children.name: Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var agentInfo = agentsAPI.getAgent("<agent_ID>"); if (!gs.nil(agentInfo.error)) gs.error(agentInfo.error); else gs.info("agent status: " + agentInfo.agent.status);
children.text2: The following  shows how to display an agent's status.

children.name: agentID
children.text: String
children.text2: Unique ID of an agent listed in the Agent ID column of the Agent Client Collectors [sn_agent_cmdb_ci_agent] table.

children.name: <Object>
Output
Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var agentInfo = agentsAPI.getAgent("<agent_ID>"); gs.info(JSON.stringify(agentInfo, null, 2));
children.text2: The following  shows how to get all agent details.

children.name: error
children.text:
Error message. Null if there is no error.

Data type: String

children.name: agent
children.text:
"agent": {
   "agent_id": "String",
   "data_collection": Number,
   "ip_address": "String",
   "is_duplicate": Boolean,
   "is_restart_enabled": Boolean,
   "name": "String",
   "number_of_running_checks": Number,
   "status": Number,
   "up_since": "String",
   "version": "String"
 }

children.name: agent.agent_id
children.text:
ID of the agent as submitted.

Data type: String

children.name: agent.data_collection
children.text:
Data collection indicates whether scheduled checks are to be run. These checks are a part of the policies scheduled for this agent to run.
Possible values:
  • 0: On – Checks run as scheduled.
  • 1: Off (manual) – Checks have been disabled manually.
  • 2: Off (auto) – Checks have been disabled automatically due to high CPU consumption by the

Data type: Number

children.name: agent.ip_address
children.text:
Agent IP address.

Data type: String

children.name: agent.is_duplicate
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether this agent is a duplicate of another. There should be only a single agent on a given host.

Possible values:
  • true: The agent has the same host as an Alive/Up agent with a different agent ID. Turn off or uninstall the duplicate
  • false: This agent has no duplicates in the Alive/Up state.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: agent.is_restart_enabled
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether restart is enabled. Agent restart is not configurable. It depends on the OS and the version of the OS the agent is running on.

Possible values:
  • true: Restart is enabled for this agent.
  • false: Restart is disabled for this agent.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: agent.name
children.text:
Name of the agent.

Data type: String

children.name: agent.number_of_running_checks
children.text:
The number of checks the agent is scheduled to run. These checks are a part of the policies scheduled for this agent to run.

Data type: Number

children.name: agent.status
children.text:
Status of the agent.
Possible values:
  • 0: Alive/Up – The agent is active.
  • 1: Warning – The agent has not received a keep-alive message in the past few minutes.
  • 2: Down – The agent has not received a keep-alive message in a long time.
  • 3: Restarting – The agent is restarting.

Data type: Number

children.name: agent.up_since
children.text:
UTC time since the agent's status became alive/up. The value is in GlideDateTime format.

Data type: String

children.name: agent.version
children.text:
Version of Agent Client Collector the agent is running.

Data type: String

children.name: getAgent(String agentID)
children.text: Gets the information of a specified agent.
children.text2:
To get a list of agent IDs:

  • Run the getAgentsList() method.
  • Check the Agent ID column of the Agent Client Collectors [sn_agent_cmdb_ci_agent] table.
  • Run the Agent Client Collector GET list REST API.

children.name: encodedQuery
children.text: String
children.text2: Encoded query string in standard Glide format. See Encoded query strings.

children.name: <Array>
children.text:
Array of JSON objects containing extended agent information.
[
 {
   "agent_id": "String",
   "data_collection": Number,
   "ip_address": "String",
   "is_duplicate": Boolean,
   "is_restart_enabled": Boolean,
   "name": "String",
   "number_of_running_checks": Number,
   "status": Number,
   "up_since": "String",
   "version": "String"
 }
]

children.name: Output
children.text:
[
  {
    "name": "007-175",
    "status": 0,
    "agent_id": "007-175",
    "ip_address": "11.222.63.66",
    "number_of_running_checks": 0,
    "data_collection": 0,
    "is_restart_enabled": false,
    "is_duplicate": false,
    "up_since": "2021-03-24 14:36:45",
    "version": "2.4.0"
  },
  {
    "name": "win2016-dc-64bit",
    "status": 0,
    "agent_id": "007-64",
    "ip_address": "10.222.333.42",
    "number_of_running_checks": 1,
    "data_collection": 0,
    "is_restart_enabled": true,
    "is_duplicate": false,
    "up_since": "2021-03-24 11:04:38",
    "version": "2.4.0"
  }
]

children.name: Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var agentList = agentsApi.getAgentsList("agent_extended_info.status!=2", 2); gs.info(JSON.stringify(agentList, null, 2));
children.text2:
The following  shows how to restrict results by query and number. The query returns
        all agents that are not in the down state with a maximum of two results.

children.name: agent_id
children.text:
ID of the agent as submitted.

Data type: String

children.name: Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var agentList = agentsApi.getAgentsList(null, 0); gs.info(JSON.stringify(agentList, null, 2));
children.text2:
The following  shows how to list every agent in the system. This example uses no
        query and no maximum number of results.

children.name: limit
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Optional. Restricts results to a maximum number of agents. Use null or undefined for both if they are not required.

Default/Max: 20,000

children.name: data_collection
children.text:
Data collection indicates whether scheduled checks are to be run. These checks are a part of the policies scheduled for this agent to run.
Possible values:
  • 0: On – Checks run as scheduled.
  • 1: Off (manual) – Checks have been disabled manually.
  • 2: Off (auto) – Checks have been disabled automatically due to high CPU consumption by the

Data type: Number

children.name: Output
children.text:
sn_agent: agent with id: 000a00e0aa1aa3a4
sn_agent: agent with id: 000a00e1aa1aa3a4
sn_agent: agent with id: 000a00e2aa1aa3a4

children.name: Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var agentsList = agentsApi.getAgentsList(null, 0); for (var i = 0; i < agentsList.length; i++) gs.info("agent with id: " + agentsList[i].agent_id);
children.text2:
The following  shows how to iterate over the results provided and displays each
        agent ID.

children.name: ip_address
children.text:
Agent IP address.

Data type: String

children.name: is_duplicate
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether this agent is a duplicate of another. There should be only a single agent on a given host.

Possible values:
  • true: The agent has the same host as an Alive/Up agent with a different agent ID. Turn off or uninstall the duplicate
  • false: This agent has no duplicates in the Alive/Up state.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: is_restart_enabled
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether restart is enabled. Agent restart is not configurable. It depends on the OS and the version of the OS the agent is running on.

Possible values:
  • true: Restart is enabled for this agent.
  • false: Restart is disabled for this agent.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: name
children.text:
Name of the agent.

Data type: String

children.name: number_of_running_checks
children.text:
The number of checks the agent is scheduled to run. These checks are a part of the policies scheduled for this agent to run.

Data type: Number

children.name: status
children.text:
Status of the agent.
Possible values:
  • 0: Alive/Up – The agent is active.
  • 1: Warning – The agent has not received a keep-alive message in the past few minutes.
  • 2: Down – The agent has not received a keep-alive message in a long time.
  • 3: Restarting – The agent is restarting.

Data type: Number

children.name: up_since
children.text:
UTC time since the agent's status became alive/up. The value is in GlideDateTime format.

Data type: String

children.name: version
children.text:
Version of Agent Client Collector the agent is running.

Data type: String

children.name: getAgentsList(String encodedQuery, Number limit)
children.text: Gets a list of agents with related information.

children.name: Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var err = agentsApi.restartAgent("<agent_ID>"); if (!gs.nil(err)) gs.error(err);
children.text2: The following  shows how to restart an agent.

children.name: String
children.text: Error message if applicable, null otherwise.

children.name: agentID
children.text: String
children.text2: Unique ID of an agent listed in the Agent ID column of the Agent Client Collectors [sn_agent_cmdb_ci_agent] table.

children.name: restartAgent(String agentID)
children.text: Restarts a specified agent with alive/up status.
children.text2:
If Agent Client Collector performance issues occur, you can restart the agent. Manual restart is supported in the following environments:

  • Linux-based agents using systemd
  • Windows agents

To get a list of agent IDs:

  • Run the getAgentsList() method.
  • Check the Agent ID column of the Agent Client Collectors [sn_agent_cmdb_ci_agent] table.
  • Run the Agent Client Collector GET list REST API.

children.name: agentID
children.text: String
children.text2: Unique ID of an agent listed in the Agent ID column of the Agent Client Collectors [sn_agent_cmdb_ci_agent] table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var err = agentsApi.runDiscovery("<agent_ID>"); if (!gs.nil(err)) gs.error(err);
children.text2: The following  shows how to run discovery on an agent with alive/up status.

children.name: String
children.text: Error message if applicable, null otherwise. For example, Agent With ID: <agentID> Is Not Up: no thrown error.

children.name: runDiscovery(String agentID)
children.text: Runs a discovery check to locate CIs related to an agent. The specified agent must be in alive/up status.
children.text2:
To get a list of agent IDs:

  • Run the getAgentsList() method.
  • Check the Agent ID column of the Agent Client Collectors [sn_agent_cmdb_ci_agent] table.
  • Run the Agent Client Collector GET list REST API.

children.name: String
children.text: Error message if applicable, null otherwise. For example, Agent With ID: <agentID> Is Not Up: no thrown error.

children.name: agentID
children.text: String
children.text2: Unique ID of an agent listed in the Agent ID column of the Agent Client Collectors [sn_agent_cmdb_ci_agent] table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var err = agentsApi.setDataCollectionStatus("<agentID>", true); if (!gs.nil(err)) gs.error(err);
children.text2: The following  shows how to turn on agent data collection.

children.name: status
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether data collection is enabled for the agent.

Valid values:
  • true: Enables data collection for this agent.
  • false: Disables data collection for this agent.

Default: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var err = agentsApi.setDataCollectionStatus("<agentID>", false); if (!gs.nil(err)) gs.error(err);
children.text2: The following  shows how to turn off agent data collection.

children.name: setDataCollectionStatus(String agentID, Boolean status)
children.text:
Set the given data collection status (true/false if enabled or not) for a specified
    agent.
children.text2:
To get a list of agent IDs:

  • Run the getAgentsList() method.
  • Check the Agent ID column of the Agent Client Collectors [sn_agent_cmdb_ci_agent] table.
  • Run the Agent Client Collector GET list REST API.

children.name: <Object>
Output
children.text: Request ID: <sys_id>

children.name: Example
children.text: var agentsApi = new sn_agent.AccAgentsAPI(); var submittedRequest = agentsApi.submitGrabLogRequest("<agentID>"); if (!gs.nil(submittedRequest.error)) gs.error(submittedRequest.error); else gs.info("Request ID: " + submittedRequest.request_id);
children.text2: The following  shows how to get a log request ID.

children.name: agentID
children.text: String
children.text2: Unique ID of an agent listed in the Agent ID column of the Agent Client Collectors [sn_agent_cmdb_ci_agent] table.

children.name: error
children.text:
Error message. Null if there is no error.

Data type: String

children.name: request_id
children.text:
Sys_id of a request in the Agent Client Collector Requests [sn_agent_request] table.

You can use this ID to get the status of the request using GET /agents/{request_id}/.

Data type: String

children.name: submitGrabLogRequest(String agentId)
children.text: Requests the log of a specified agent with alive/up status.
children.text2: Note: To retrieve the log and check its progress, pass the request ID returned to the checkGrabLogRequestProgress() method.

name: AccAgentsAPI API
text: The AccAgentsAPI script include enables performing management actions on available agents.
text2:
This API requires the Agent Client Collector Framework (sn_agent) store application and is provided within the sn_agent namespace. For more information, refer to Agent Client Collector.

For the REST API solution, refer to Agent Client Collector API .

This API includes methods that enable the following:
  • Getting extensive information of one or more agents.
  • Submitting a request to grab an agent log and retrieving information about the request progress.
  • Starting or stopping data collection.
  • Restarting an agent.
  • Running discovery on an agent.

children.name: check
children.text:
Details of the specified check definition.
"check ": {
 "background": Boolean,
 "check_group": "String",
 "check_type": "String",
 "command": "String",
 "error": "String",
 "name": "String",
 "params": [Array],
 "plugins": [Array],
 "proxy_valid": Boolean,
 "secure_params": [Array],
 "sys_id": "String",
 "timeout": Number
}

children.name: checkDefId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of the check definition listed in the Check Definitions [sn_agent_check_def] table.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var checkDefId = "94436b237f705300f128134f8dfa91a4"; var withParams = true; var checkDef = sn_agent.AccCheckDefsAPI.getCheck(checkDefId, withParams); gs.info(JSON.stringify(checkDef, null, 2));
children.text2: The following  shows how to get information for a specified check definition.

children.name: withParams
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether existing check parameter details are returned. Information for each standard and secure check parameter is included in a JSON object.
Valid values:
  • true: Return check parameter details.
  • false: Do not return check parameter details.

Default: False

children.name: check.background
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether this check definition is a background check. A background check is a check which the agent starts execution of and doesn’t wait for it to finish running.
Valid values:
  • true: This check definition is a background check.
  • false: This check definition is not a background check.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: check.check_group
children.text:
Group specified for this check definition.

Data type: String

children.name: check.check_type
children.text:
Type of check.
Possible values:
  • Events – Check results are transformed into an Event Management event.
  • Metrics – Values from the check result are transformed to metrics.

Data type: String

children.name: check.command
children.text:
Command that the Agent Client Collector executes.

Data type: String

children.name: check.error
children.text:
Message if there is an error. Null otherwise.

Data type: String

children.name: check.name
children.text:
Name of the check.

Data type: String

children.name: check.params
children.text:
List of parameter definitions associated with the check definition. These results are only included if the withParams parameter is set to true.
"params": [
  {
    "active": Boolean,
    "default_value": "String",
    "mandatory": Boolean,
    "name": "String",
    "sys_id": "String"
   }
]

Data type: Array

children.name: check.params.active
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the check parameter is active.
Valid values:
  • true: The check parameter is active.
  • false: The check parameter is inactive.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: check.params.default_value
children.text:
Specifies the default value for this check parameter.

Data type: String

children.name: check.params.mandatory
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the check parameter is required.
Valid values:
  • true: The check parameter is required.
  • false: The check parameter is optional.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: check.params.name
children.text:
Name of the check parameter.

Data type: String

children.name: check.params.sys_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the check parameter listed in the Check Secure Parameter Definitions [sn_agent_check_param_def] table.

Data type: String

children.name: check.plugins
children.text:
List of Agent Client Collector plugins associated with this check.

Data type: Array

children.name: check.proxy_valid
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the check definition policy is set to work as a proxy.
Valid values:
  • true: This check definition policy is set to work as a proxy.
  • false: This check definition policy is not set to work as a proxy.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: check.secure_params
children.text:
List of assigned to this check. These results are only included if the withParams parameter is set to true.
"secure_params": [
  {
    "active": Boolean,
    "name": "String",
    "order": Number,
    "sys_id": "String"
   }
]

Data type: Array

children.name: check.secure_params.active
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the secure parameter is active.
Valid values:
  • true: The secure parameter is active.
  • false: The secure parameter is inactive.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: check.secure_params.name
children.text:
Name of the secure parameter.

Data type: String

children.name: check.secure_params.order
children.text:
Order in which the parameter is sent to the check command/script.

Data type: Number

children.name: check.secure_params.sys_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the secure parameter listed in the Check Secure Parameter Definitions [sn_agent_check_secure_param_def] table.

Data type: String

children.name: check.sys_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the check definition listed in the Check Definitions [sn_agent_check_def] table.

Data type: String

children.name: check.timeout
children.text:
Timeout in seconds.

Data type: Number

children.name: getCheck(String checkDefId, Boolean withParams)
children.text: Gets a specified check definition with details.

children.name: encodedQuery
children.text: String
children.text2: An encoded query string to filter the check definition result list. Use null for an unfiltered list of check definitions in the system.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var encQuery = "nameSTARTSWITHchecks_"; var limit = 2; var withParams = true; var checkDefs = sn_agent.AccCheckDefsAPI.getChecksList(encQuery, limit, withParams); gs.info(JSON.stringify(checkDefs, null, 2));
children.text2:
The following  shows how to retrieve a list of two check definitions with parameter
        values.

children.name: check definitions
children.text:
List of check definition and details provided as JSON objects.
[
  {
    "background": Boolean,
    "check_group": "String",
    "check_type": "String",
    "command": "String",
    "name": "String",
    "params": [Array],
    "plugins": [Array],
    "proxy_valid": Boolean,
    "secure_params": [Array],
    "sys_id": "String",
    "timeout": Number
  }
]

Data type: Array

children.name: limit
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Limits the number of returned records. Set to null to use the default value.

Default: 20,000

children.name: background
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether this check definition is a background check. A background check is a check which the agent starts execution of and doesn’t wait for it to finish running.
Valid values:
  • true: This check definition is a background check.
  • false: This check definition is not a background check.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: check_group
children.text:
Group specified for this check definition.

Data type: String

children.name: withParams
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether existing check parameter details are returned. Information for each standard and secure check parameter is included in a JSON object.
Valid values:
  • true: Return check parameter details.
  • false: Do not return check parameter details.

Default: False

children.name: check_type
children.text:
Type of check.
Possible values:
  • Events – Check results are transformed into an Event Management event.
  • Metrics – Values from the check result are transformed to metrics.

Data type: String

children.name: command
children.text:
Command that the Agent Client Collector executes.

Data type: String

children.name: name
children.text:
Name of the check.

Data type: String

children.name: params
children.text:
List of parameter definitions associated with the check definition. These results are only included if the withParams parameter is set to true.
"params": [
  {
    "active": Boolean,
    "default_value": "String",
    "mandatory": Boolean,
    "name": "String",
    "sys_id": "String"
   }
]

Data type: Array

children.name: params.active
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the check parameter is active.
Valid values:
  • true: The check parameter is active.
  • false: The check parameter is inactive.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: params.default_value
children.text:
Specifies the default value for this check parameter.

Data type: String

children.name: params.mandatory
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the check parameter is required.
Valid values:
  • true: The check parameter is required.
  • false: The check parameter is optional.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: params.name
children.text:
Name of the check parameter.

Data type: String

children.name: params.sys_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the check parameter listed in the Check Secure Parameter Definitions [sn_agent_check_param_def] table.

Data type: String

children.name: plugins
children.text:
List of Agent Client Collector plugins associated with this check.

Data type: Array

children.name: proxy_valid
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the check definition policy is set to work as a proxy.
Valid values:
  • true: This check definition policy is set to work as a proxy.
  • false: This check definition policy is not set to work as a proxy.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: secure_params
children.text:
List of assigned to this check. These results are only included if the withParams parameter is set to true.
"secure_params": [
  {
    "active": Boolean,
    "name": "String",
    "order": Number,
    "sys_id": "String"
   }
]

Data type: Array

children.name: secure_params.active
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the secure parameter is active.
Valid values:
  • true: The secure parameter is active.
  • false: The secure parameter is inactive.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: secure_params.name
children.text:
Name of the secure parameter.

Data type: String

children.name: secure_params.order
children.text:
Order in which the parameter is sent to the check command/script.

Data type: Number

children.name: secure_params.sys_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the secure parameter listed in the Check Secure Parameter Definitions [sn_agent_check_secure_param_def] table.

Data type: String

children.name: sys_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the check definition listed in the Check Definitions [sn_agent_check_def] table.

Data type: String

children.name: timeout
children.text:
Timeout in seconds.

Data type: Number

children.name: getChecksList(String encodedQuery, Number limit, Boolean withParams)
children.text: Gets a list of check definitions with details.
children.text2: See also Checks and policies.

children.name: None
children.text: Error message if unsuccessful.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkJson = sn_agent.AccCheckDefsAPI.getCheck(activeCheckDefs[0].sys_id, true); if (!gs.nil(checkJson.error)) gs.error(checkJson.error); var updateJson = {active: "0"}; // deactivate the check definition sn_agent.AccCheckDefsAPI.updateCheck(checkJson.check.sys_id, updateJson);
children.text2: The following  shows how to deactivate a check definition.

children.name: checkDefId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of the check definition listed in the Check Definitions [sn_agent_check_def] table.

children.name: updateJson
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Map of check definition fields to be updated to their new values. Refer to the data dictionary for a comprehensive list of Check Definition fields and types.
{
 "background": Boolean,
 "check_group": "String",
 "check_type": "String",
 "command": "String",
 "name": "String",
 "plugins": [Array],
 "proxy_valid": Boolean,
 "timeout": Number
}

children.name: updateJson.active
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Indicates whether this check definition is active.
Valid values:
  • 0: This check definition is inactive.
  • 1: This check definition is active.

children.name: updateJson.background
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether this check definition is a background check. A background check is a check which the agent starts execution of and doesn’t wait for it to finish running.
Valid values:
  • true: This check definition is a background check.
  • false: This check definition is not a background check.

children.name: updateJson.check_group
children.text: String
children.text2: Group specified for this check definition.

children.name: updateJson.check_type
children.text: String
children.text2:
Type of check.
Possible values:
  • Events – Check results are transformed into an Event Management event.
  • Metrics – Values from the check result are transformed to metrics.

children.name: updateJson.command
children.text: String
children.text2: Command that the Agent Client Collector executes.

children.name: updateJson.name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the check.

children.name: updateJson.plugins
children.text: Array
children.text2: List of Agent Client Collector plugins associated with this check.

children.name: updateJson.proxy_valid
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether the check definition policy is set to work as a proxy.

Valid values:
  • true: This check definition policy is set to work as a proxy.
  • false: This check definition policy is not set to work as a proxy.

children.name: updateJson.timeout
children.text: Number
children.text2: Timeout in seconds.

children.name: updateCheck(String checkDefId, Object updateJson)
children.text: Enables changing one or more field values of a specified check definition.
children.text2: See also Checks and policies.

children.name: checkDefParamId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of the check parameter listed in the Check Parameter Definitions
                [sn_agent_check_param_def] table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkParmSysId = "cd922ce6dba530106f4810284b961966"; var updateJson = {"active": "true"}; sn_agent.AccCheckDefsAPI.updateCheckSecureParam(checkParmSysId, updateJson);
children.text2: The following  shows how to activate a check parameter.

children.name: None
children.text: Error message if unsuccessful.

children.name: updateJson
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Map of check parameter fields to be updated to their new values. Refer to the data dictionary for a comprehensive list of Check Secure Parameter Definition fields and types.
{
 "active": Boolean,
 "default_value": "String",
 "mandatory": Boolean,
 "name": "String"
}

children.name: updateJson.active
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether the check parameter is active.

Valid values:
  • true: The check parameter is active.
  • false: The check parameter is inactive.

children.name: updateJson.default_value
children.text: String
children.text2: Specifies the default value for this check parameter.

children.name: updateJson.mandatory
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether the check parameter is required.

Valid values:
  • true: The check parameter is required.
  • false: The check parameter is optional.

children.name: updateJson.name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the check parameter.

children.name: updateCheckParam(String checkDefParamId, Object updateJson)
children.text: Enables changing one or more field values of a specified check parameter.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkSecParmSysId = "<sys_id>"; var updateJson = {"active": "true"}; sn_agent.AccCheckDefsAPI.updateCheckSecureParam(checkSecParmSysId, updateJson);
children.text2: The following  shows how to activate a check secure parameter.

children.name: None
children.text: Error message if unsuccessful.

children.name: checkDefSecureParamId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of the secure parameter listed in the Check Secure Parameter Definitions
                [sn_agent_check_secure_param_def] table.

children.name: updateJson
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Map of check secure parameter fields to be updated to their new values. Refer to the data dictionary for a comprehensive list of Check Secure Parameter Definition fields and types.
{
 "active": Boolean,
 "name": "String",
 "order": Number
}

children.name: updateJson.active
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether the secure parameter is active.

Valid values:
  • true: The secure parameter is active.
  • false: The secure parameter is inactive.

children.name: updateJson.name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the secure parameter.

children.name: updateJson.order
children.text: Number
children.text2: Order in which the parameter is sent to the check command/script.

children.name: updateCheckSecureParam(String checkDefSecureParamId, Object updateJson)
children.text: Enables changing one or more field values of a specified check secure parameter.

name: AccCheckDefsAPI API
text: The AccCheckDefsAPI script include enables managing check definitions and associated parameters.
text2:
This API requires the Agent Client Collector Framework (sn_agent) store application and is provided within the sn_agent namespace. This API requires the agent_client_collector_admin role. For more information, refer to Agent Client Collector.

This API does not have a constructor for creating an instance. Call each method using the AccCheckDefsAPI static class in the following format:

sn_agent.AccCheckDefsAPI.<method>

For the REST API solution, refer to Agent Client Collector API .

This API includes methods that enable the following:
  • Get a specified check definition
  • Get a list of check definitions
  • Update checks and check parameters

children.name: Example
children.text: var handler = new sn_agent.AgentNowHandler();
children.text2: The following shows how to initialize AgentNowHandler.

children.name: AgentNowHandler()
children.text: Creates an AgentNowHandler instance.

children.name: Object
children.text: Status of the request and any applicable error message.

children.name: Example
children.text: var handler = new sn_agent.AgentNowHandler(); var check = {checkDefId: "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"}; var computerGr = new GlideRecord("cmdb_ci_computer"); computerGr.query(); var requestId = handler.runCheckForCis(computerGr, check, 0, 60); var reqStatusJson = handler.getRequestStatus(requestId); gs.info(JSON.stringify(reqStatusJson));
children.text2: The following  shows how to get the status of a request.

children.name: requestId
children.text: String
children.text2: A check request ID generated by calling the runCheckForCis() method.

children.name: status
children.text:
Request status.
Possible values:
  • done – Check is successful.
  • failure – Check has failed. See error message for details.
  • mid_flow – Request output is being handled by the MID server.
  • processing – Check is in progress.
  • timeout – Check processing exceeded time limit set in the runCheckForCis() method.

Data type: String

children.name: err_msg
children.text:
Error message if any.
Possible values:
  • No agents found for relevant CIs.
  • No background check request with given ID.
  • No request with given ID.
  • No test result with given ID.
  • Request timeout.

Data type: String

children.name: getRequestStatus(String requestId)
children.text: Gets status of the request with the given ID.

children.name: status
children.text:
Status of the test results.
Possible values:
  • 0: Pending
  • 1: In progress
  • 2: Complete
  • 3: No test result with given ID

Data type: String

children.name: testResultId
children.text: String
children.text2: A test result ID generated by creating a test check request.

children.name: Example
children.text: var testCheckStatusJson = handler.getTestResultStatus("testResultId"); gs.info(JSON.stringify(testCheckStatusJson));
children.text2: The following  shows how get result status of a completed test check request.

children.name: output
children.text:
Output describing the status.

Data type: String

children.name: getTestResultStatus(String testResultId)
children.text: Gets the test check status of the given test result.

children.name: String
children.text: Sys_id of the generated background check request.

children.name: cis
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
GlideRecord of any CMDB table (any application, host, or agent) that the check
                is working against.

children.name: Example
children.text: var handler = new sn_agent.AgentNowHandler(); var check = {checkDefId: "028fcd5067c80010b7b72dbd2685ef4f"}; var computerGr = new GlideRecord("cmdb_ci_computer"); computerGr.query(); var requestId = handler.runCheckForCis(computerGr, check, 0, 60); gs.info(requestId);
children.text2: The following  shows how to run a background check and get its request ID.

children.name: check
children.text: Object

children.name: check.checkDefId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a check definition in the Check Definitions [sn_agent_check_def] table.

children.name: check.params
children.text: Object

children.name: priority
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Priority of the request to be set on the ECC queue.
Possible values:
  • 0: interactive
  • 1: expedited
  • 2: standard

children.name: timeout
children.text: Number
children.text2: Value of the timeout for the request in seconds.

children.name: runCheckForCis(Object cis, Object check, Number priority, Number timeout)
children.text: Runs a check against the given configuration item.

children.name: requestId
children.text: String
children.text2: The ID of a background check request generated by calling the runCheckForCis() method.

children.name: Example
children.text: handler.stopBackgroundCheck(backRequestId);
children.text2: The following  shows how stop executing a background check.

children.name: stopBackgroundCheck(String requestId)
children.text: Stops a background check.
children.text2: To start a background check, use the runCheckForCis() method.

name: AgentNowHandler API
text: The AccCheckDefsAPI script include enables running check definitions on demand, checking the status of on demand executions and test check executions and for stopping background checks that were executed on demand.
text2:
This API requires the Agent Client Collector Framework (sn_agent) store application and is provided within the sn_agent namespace. For more information, refer to Agent Client Collector.

For the REST API solution, refer to Agent Client Collector API .

children.name: Example
children.text: var builder = new sn_agent.CheckDefinitionTestBuilder();
children.text2: The following shows how to initialize CheckDefinitionTestBuilder.

children.name: CheckDefinitionTestBuilder()
children.text: Creates an CheckDefinitionTestBuilder instance.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var ciId = "cc0dcc855374301062d1ddeeff7b12b0"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckDefinitionTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCiId(ciId).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how build a test check request:

children.name: Object
children.text: JSON object with two attributes – the test result record ID and an error. If the build is successful, the test result ID returns and error is null. If an error occurs during the build, the test result ID is null and the error displays.

children.name: build()
children.text: Builds the test check request with the arguments set.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var ciId = "cc0dcc855374301062d1ddeeff7b12b0"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckDefinitionTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCiId(ciId).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check.

children.name: CheckDefinitionTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: checkId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of the check definition listed in the Check Definitions [sn_agent_check_def] table.

children.name: withCheckId(String checkId)
children.text: Sets the sys_id of the check definition to test.

children.name: ciId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a CMDB Configuration Item.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var ciId = "cc0dcc855374301062d1ddeeff7b12b0"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckDefinitionTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCiId(ciId).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how to create a test check request with

children.name: CheckDefinitionTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: withCiId(String ciId)
children.text: Sets the sys_id of the configuration item to run the test against.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var credAlias = "<sys_id>"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckDefinitionTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCredentialsAliasId(credAlias).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check and set the credentials alias ID.

children.name: CheckDefinitionTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: credentialsAliasId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a credentials record.

children.name: withCredentialsAliasId(String credentialsAliasId)
children.text: Sets the credentials alias sys_id to use during the test.
children.text2: Note: Running this removes any previous assignment done by calling withCredentialsName, withCredentialsAliasId or withCredentialsAliasName.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var credentialsAliasName = "credentialsAliasName"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckDefinitionTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCredentialsAliasName(credentialsAliasName).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check and set the credentials alias name.

children.name: CheckDefinitionTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: credentialsAliasName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of a credentials alias.

children.name: withCredentialsAliasName(String credentialsAliasName)
children.text: Sets the credentials alias name to use during the test. If the given value matches the name of multiple credentials aliases records, then one of them is chosen randomly.
children.text2: Note: Running this removes any previous assignment done by calling withCredentialsName, withCredentialsAliasId or withCredentialsAliasName.

children.name: credentialsId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a credentials record.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var credID = "<sys_id>"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckDefinitionTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCredentialsId(credID).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check and set the credentials ID.

children.name: CheckDefinitionTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: withCredentialsId(String credentialsId)
children.text: Sets the credentials sys_id to use during the test.
children.text2: Note: Running this removes any previous assignment done by calling withCredentialsName, withCredentialsAliasId or withCredentialsAliasName.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var credname = "credentialsName"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckDefinitionTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCredentialsName(credName).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check and set the credentials name.

children.name: CheckDefinitionTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: credentialsName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the credentials record.

children.name: withCredentialsName(String credentialsName)
children.text: Sets the credentials name to use during the test. If the given value is the name of several credentials records, then one of them is chosen randomly.
children.text2: Note: Running this removes any previous assignment done by calling withCredentialsName, withCredentialsAliasId or withCredentialsAliasName.

name: CheckDefinitionTestBuilder API
text: The CheckDefinitionTestBuilder script include enables building test check requests on check definitions.
text2:
This API requires the Agent Client Collector Framework (sn_agent) store application and is provided within the sn_agent namespace. For more information, refer to Agent Client Collector.

For the REST API solution, refer to Agent Client Collector API .

This API includes methods that enable the following:
  • Set the check definition to test
  • Set the configuration item to run the test against
You can also specify one of the following identifiers to use during the test:
  • Credential sys_id
  • Credential alias id
  • Credential name

children.name: Example
children.text: var builder = new sn_agent.CheckInstanceTestBuilder();
children.text2: The following shows how to initialize CheckInstanceTestBuilder.

children.name: CheckInstanceTestBuilder()
children.text: Creates an CheckInstanceTestBuilder instance.

children.name: Object
children.text: JSON object with two attributes – the test result record ID and an error. If the build is successful, the test result ID returns and error is null. If an error occurs during the build, the test result ID is null and the error displays.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var ciId = "cc0dcc855374301062d1ddeeff7b12b0"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckInstanceTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCiId(ciId).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how build a test check request:

children.name: build()
children.text: Builds the test check request with the arguments set.

children.name: checkId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of the check definition listed in the Check Definitions [sn_agent_check_def] table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var ciId = "cc0dcc855374301062d1ddeeff7b12b0"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckInstanceTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCiId(ciId).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check.

children.name: CheckInstanceTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: withCheckId(String checkId)
children.text: Sets the sys_id of the check definition to test.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var ciId = "cc0dcc855374301062d1ddeeff7b12b0"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckInstanceTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCiId(ciId).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how to create a test check request with

children.name: CheckInstanceTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: ciId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a CMDB Configuration Item.

children.name: withCiId(String ciId)
children.text: Sets the sys_id of the configuration item to run the test against.

children.name: CheckInstanceTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: credentialsAliasId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a credentials alias record.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var credAlias = "<sys_id>"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckInstanceTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCredentialsAliasId(credAlias).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check and set the credentials alias ID.

children.name: withCredentialsAliasId(String credentialsAliasId)
children.text: Sets the credentials alias sys_id to use during the test.
children.text2: Note: Running this removes any previous assignment done by calling withCredentialsName, withCredentialsAliasId or withCredentialsAliasName.

children.name: credentialsAliasName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of a credentials alias.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var credentialsAliasName = "credentialsAliasName"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckInstanceTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCredentialsAliasName(credentialsAliasName).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check and set the credentials alias name.

children.name: CheckInstanceTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: withCredentialsAliasName(String credentialsAliasName)
children.text: Sets the credentials alias name to use during the test. If the given value matches the name of multiple credentials aliases records, then one of them is chosen randomly.
children.text2: Note: Running this removes any previous assignment done by calling withCredentialsName, withCredentialsAliasId or withCredentialsAliasName.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var credID = "<sys_id>"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckInstanceTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCredentialsId(credID).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check and set the credentials ID.

children.name: CheckInstanceTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: credentialsId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a credentials record.

children.name: withCredentialsId(String credentialsId)
children.text: Sets the credentials sys_id to use during the test.
children.text2: Note: Running this removes any previous assignment done by calling withCredentialsName, withCredentialsAliasId or withCredentialsAliasName.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var credname = "credentialsName"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckInstanceTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withCredentialsName(credName).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check and set the credentials name.

children.name: CheckInstanceTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: credentialsName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the credentials record.

children.name: withCredentialsName(String credentialsName)
children.text: Sets the credentials name to use during the test. If the given value is the name of several credentials records, then one of them is chosen randomly.
children.text2: Note: Running this removes any previous assignment done by calling withCredentialsName, withCredentialsAliasId or withCredentialsAliasName.

children.name: agentId
children.text: String
children.text2: Unique ID of an agent proxy to run this check. This value is listed in the Agent ID column of the Agent Client Collectors [sn_agent_cmdb_ci_agent] table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkId = "158279505372b30034b8ddeeff7b1270"; var agentId = "<agentID>"; var builder = new sn_agent.CheckInstanceTestBuilder(); var testResultJson = builder.withCheckId(checkId).withAgentId(agentId).build(); if (!gs.nil(testResultJson.error)) gs.error(testResultJson.error);
children.text2: The following  shows how create a test check and set the proxy agent ID.

children.name: CheckInstanceTestBuilder
children.text: The builder instance the method was invoked for.

children.name: withProxyAgentId(String agentId)
children.text:
Sets the agent to run the test. Allowed only in case the tested check instance and
    policy are proxy.

name: CheckInstanceTestBuilder API
text: The CheckInstanceTestBuilder script include enables building test check requests on check instances.
text2:
This API requires the Agent Client Collector Framework (sn_agent) store application and is provided within the sn_agent namespace. For more information, refer to Agent Client Collector.

For the REST API solution, refer to Agent Client Collector API .

This API includes methods that enable the following:
  • Set the check instance to test
  • Set the configuration item to run the test against
You can also specify one of the following identifiers to use during the test:
  • Credential sys_id
  • Credential alias id
  • Credential name
